mismatches.extracted: The study uses fourth-grade students' mathematics and science test scores from the 2003 TIMSS dataset to evaluate the relationship between the roles of schools and family in students' learning outcomes across 25 countries, considering factors such as national income and income inequality using both OLS and HLM models.
mismatches.expected: The study uses hierarchical linear model (HLM) analyses to decompose variance attributable to schools and calculate the correlation between school-effect for math achievement and country Gini index.

extracted: Data collected from 2003 TIMSS involving fourth-grade students across 25 countries.
Calculation of SESEDCAP as a measure of socioeconomic status.
Use of Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) models with school fixed effects to assess variance in test scores.
Application of Hierarchical Linear Models (HLM) to partition variance attributable to schools and family.
Comparison of the effect sizes in relation to economic and inequality measures.
expected: Conduct 25 sets of separate country-level HLM analyses.
Calculate the correlation between Variance Component of the Intercept for Math and External Gini Index.

mismatches.extracted: The study finds that in countries characterized by high levels of income inequality, schools have a more significant impact on student achievement compared to family characteristics. Schools seem to be relatively more important in countries with higher unequal distribution of resources.
mismatches.expected: The original study found a positive correlation between the Gini index and school-effect for math achievement.

expected.outcome_name: Correlation between GINI index and math achievement

mismatches.extracted: 1. Load the TIMSS 2003 dataset. 2. Perform descriptive statistical analysis of the dataset. 3. Conduct Ordinary Least Squares (OLS) regression with school fixed effects to evaluate the variance in mathematics and science achievement scores. 4. Apply Hierarchical Linear Modeling (HLM) to decompose variance attributable to student, family, and school level. 5. Analyze the relationship between economic indicators (GDP, Gini index) and school effects on achievement using correlation analysis.
mismatches.expected: Conduct 48 sets of separate country-level hierarchical linear model (HLM) analyses and calculate the correlation between Variance Component of the Intercept for Math and External Gini Index for 48 countries.

mismatches.extracted: Correlation coefficients, variance partitioning into between-school and within-school components, interpretation of intercept and SES coefficients
